p: Fig. 1 shows the structure of the molecule bis(acetylacetonato)copper(II), [Cu(acac) 2]. The neutral d 9 molecule has a spin state of ½, therefore contains one unpaired electron, as is expected for Cu(II) complexes [1], [2], [3]. Fig. 2 shows the four Cu–O bond lengths within molecule [Cu II(acac) 2], for each of 49 different crystals obtained from the CSD [4]. The experimentally obtained Cu–O bond lengths vary between 1.898 and 1.942 Å, with an average of 1.919(9) Å. The experimentally obtained O–Cu–O bond angles vary between 92.0 and 94.9°, with an average of 93.7(4)°, see Fig. 3. Table 1 compares the average of the experimental data with DFT calculated geometrical data involving Cu.
